items.title: Delhi consumer forum tells IndiGo Airlines to pay Rs 1.5 lakh compensation for deficiency in service
items.description: Pinki alleged that her complaint regarding the issue was treated in a ”dismissive and insensitive manner”.

items.description: Aditya Joshi has two decades of experience and has previously worked at Apax Partners and Blackstone

items.title: 'Not dependent on one or two nations': Gadkari dismisses impact of Trump's tariff on auto sector
items.description: The comments come after Trump doubled India’s tariff to 50 percent for buying Russian oil

items.title: Infibeam to transfer e-commerce platform on slump sale basis to Rediff.com for Rs 800 crore
items.description: The move creates a 'growth runway' for both Infibeam and Rediff, said Vishal Mehta, Chairman and Managing Director, Infibeam Avenues.

items.title: KIMS: Mixed performance in Q1, but growth story remains resilient
items.description: Future growth to be fuelled by several catalysts, and it could emerge as a stronger player in the healthcare space

items.title: Titan Company: Jewellery, non-jewellery both add to the shine
items.description: Titan continues to gain market share in the key jewellery business. The ramping up of the international jewellery segment and the non-jewellery business remains an additional growth trigger

items.title: Godrej Consumer Q1 FY26: Sustained growth, stable margins on the cards
items.description: Easing palm oil prices, strong innovations will drive sequential volume growth

items.title: MapmyIndia: Growth visibility improves with margin traction in Q1 FY26
items.description: Despite subdued performance in the IoT segment due to restructuring, the company saw continued traction across fintech, logistics, public sector, and automotive verticals.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp Q1 FY26: Revenue dips, but margin in grip
items.description: Q1 performance in line with expectations; the demand outlook is strong, and the stock valuation is attractive

items.title: Can Trump’s tariff derail India’s China Plus One ambition?
items.description: Trump’s punitive tariff could cloud India’s ambition of becoming a viable alternative to China unless trade negotiations succeed. However, it could well turn out to be India’s 1991 moment, forcing the country to take long-pending economic reforms to leap into the next level

items.title: Lilly obesity pill cut weight by just 11% in study; shares drop
items.description: While the injections from Lilly and Novo have revolutionized the way obesity is treated, investors say pills are key to reaching more patients in the market that’s expected to grow to $95 billion by 2030.

items.title: Passenger vehicles, two-wheelers take automobile sales to slow lane, drop 4% in July
items.description: The dealers’ body said the overall registration declined to 19,64,213 units in July, compared to 20,52,759 units recorded in the same period of the previous year

items.title: The way to protect Indian companies from secondary sanctions
items.description: A robust blocking statute must bar Indian persons and companies from complying with any extraterritorial sanctions that conflict with national law or policy unless they obtain an explicit waiver from a designated Indian authority

items.title: Trent: Q1 FY26 results beat estimates; strong growth prospects
items.description: The company’s strategy of better sourcing terms in the wake of increased volumes, sustained pricing discipline, and continued focus on own brands would enable it to sustain margins.

items.title: TCS to roll out wage hikes after announcing plans to cut 12,000 jobs. Check details
items.description: The wage hikes are expected to cover around 80 percent of the staff, starting September 1

items.title: PVR Inox backs Aamir Khan’s YouTube release strategy, pushes for pay per view path
items.description: If the pay per view model picks up for movie releases, the multiplex chain expects that it will slowdow the streaming rush.

items.title: Divi’s Lab: Better capex guidance to meet upcoming demand
items.description: R&D activities around peptides and contrast media remain the two medium-term growth drivers for the company. US tariffs are a near-term risk.

items.title: JSW Cement IPO: Is it a solid contender for your portfolio?
items.description: Cement demand is promising in India, though there’s a shift in the competitive landscape

items.description: Market share gain in core segments, and strategic focus on premium variants will drive profitable growth

items.title: Bajaj Auto delivers a mixed Q1
items.description: Revenue growth aided by exports; margin dips on currency and cost pressures

items.description: The company is operationally strong, has a sound setup, and trusted by clients

items.title: HUL expects steady demand, bets on macros and consumption recovery to sustain momentum
items.description: Hindustan Unilever absorbed most of the price inflation in tea, keeping the product affordable and thereby supporting volume gains. However, now, the company sees price vs cost gap to narrow in the coming quarters

items.title: Demerger-ready ice cream unit may need future fund infusion for expansion: HUL CFO
items.description: Management said that given the high-growth, low-margin nature of the category, access to external funding will be crucial for future expansion
